question: Will the USDA-posted recall by Nail Factory of Ineligible Frozen Siluriformes Fish Products Imported From Vietnam issued December 19, 2024, be closed before April 1, 2025?
reasoning:
Based on the gathered evidence, here are the key points regarding the recall of frozen Siluriformes fish products by Nail Factory:

1. **Recall Details**: Nail Factory is recalling approximately 1,635 pounds of frozen Siluriformes fish products imported from Vietnam. These products were produced by an establishment not eligible to export Siluriformes fish to the United States and were not presented for import reinspection.

2. **Distribution**: The recalled products were distributed to retail locations in Arizona, California, and Iowa, as well as to nail salons.

3. **Regulatory Action**: The recall was announced by the USDA's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) on December 19, 2024, due to ineligible fish products and lack of USDA inspection.

4. **Health Impact**: There have been no confirmed reports of adverse reactions due to consumption of these products as of the latest updates.

5. **Current Status**: The recall is still active, and FSIS is conducting routine recall effectiveness checks to ensure the products are no longer available to consumers.

Given that the recall was announced in late December 2024 and considering the typical duration of such recalls, it is plausible that the recall could be closed before April 1, 2025, if the effectiveness checks are completed successfully and no further issues arise.

However, without specific updates indicating the closure of the recall, there remains uncertainty. Based on the information available, I estimate the probability that the recall will be closed before April 1, 2025, as follows:

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.6

---
title: Nail Factory recalls frozen fish products
author: Industry News
url: https://www.provisioneronline.com/articles/118039-nail-factory-recalls-frozen-fish-products
hostname: provisioneronline.com
description: Nail Factory recalls approximately 1,635 pounds of frozen Siluriformes fish products produced by a Vietnam establishment not eligible to export Siluriformes fish to the United States.
sitename: The National Provisioner
date: 2024-12-20
tags: ['USDA FSIS,frozen foods,imports,import reinspection,vietnam']
---
Nail Factory, the importer of record located in Huntington Beach, Calif., is recalling approximately 1,635 pounds of ineligible frozen Siluriformes fish products that were produced by an establishment in Vietnam that is not eligible to export Siluriformes fish to the United States. Additionally, the products were not presented for import reinspection into the US.

The following products are [subject to recall](https://www.fsis.usda.gov/sites/default/files/food_label_pdf/2024-12/Recall-032-2024-Label.pdf):

- 28.2-ounce plastic containers containing “Dac san dong que CA TRE VANG KHO TO Stewed Walking Catfish” with a “BEST BEFORE: Dec 30, 2025.”
- 28.2-ounce plastic containers containing “Dac san dong que CA HU KHO TO Stewed Shark Catfish” with a “BEST BEFORE: Dec 30, 2025.”
- 24.7-ounce plastic containers containing “Dac san dong que CA TRE VANG CHIEN NUOC MAM GUNG Fried Walking Catfish” with a “BEST BEFORE: Dec 30, 2025.”

The products do not bear an establishment number nor a USDA mark of inspection, but bear FDA Registration #10634049806. While the products bear an FDA registration number, FSIS regulates Siluriformes fish and not the FDA. These items were shipped to retail locations in Arizona, California and Iowa. The products were also distributed to nail salons, which either sold the products or used them for promotions.

FSIS discovered the ineligible Siluriformes fish products during routine surveillance activities of imported products at a retail store in California.

There have been no confirmed reports of adverse reactions due to consumption of these products. Anyone concerned about a reaction should contact a health care provider.

FSIS is concerned that consumers may be in possession of these products. Consumers who have purchased or received these products are urged not to consume them. These products should be thrown away or returned to the place of purchase.

FSIS routinely conducts recall effectiveness checks to verify recal…

# Nail Factory Recalls Ineligible Frozen Siluriformes Fish Products Imported From Vietnam

USDA Food Safety and Inspection Service sent this bulletin at 12/19/2024 09:42 PM EST[ Having trouble viewing this email? ](https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USFSIS/bulletins/3c865ed?reqfrom=share)[View it as a Web page](https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USFSIS/bulletins/3c865ed).

[Nail Factory Recalls Ineligible Frozen Siluriformes Fish Products Imported From Vietnam](https://www.fsis.usda.gov/recalls-alerts/nail-factory-recalls-ineligible-frozen-siluriformes-fish-products-imported-vietnam)

NAIL Factory, the importer of record, located in Huntington Beach, Calif., is recalling approximately 1,635 pounds of ineligible frozen Siluriformes fish products that were produced by an establishment in Vietnam that is not eligible to export Siluriformes fish to the United States, the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. Additionally, the products were not presented for import reinspection into the U.S.

{"url": "https://www.provisioneronline.com/articles/118039-nail-factory-recalls-frozen-fish-products", "snippet": "---
title: Nail Factory recalls frozen fish products
author: Industry News
url: https://www.provisioneronline.com/articles/118039-nail-factory-recalls-frozen-fish-products
hostname: provisioneronline.com
description: Nail Factory recalls approximately 1,635 pounds of frozen Siluriformes fish products produced by a Vietnam establishment not eligible to export Siluriformes fish to the United States.
sitename: The National Provisioner
date: 2024-12-20
tags: ['USDA FSIS,frozen foods,imports,import reinspection,vietnam']
---
Nail Factory, the importer of record located in Huntington Beach, Calif., is recalling approximately 1,635 pounds of ineligible frozen Siluriformes fish products that were produced by an establishment in Vietnam that is not eligible to export Siluriformes fish to the United States. Additionally, the products were not presented for import reinspection into the US.

The following products are [subject to recall](https://www.fsis.usda.gov/sites/default/files/food_label_pdf/2024-12/Recall-032-2024-Label.pdf):

- 28.2-ounce plastic containers containing “Dac san dong que CA TRE VANG KHO TO Stewed Walking Catfish” with a “BEST BEFORE: Dec 30, 2025.”
- 28.2-ounce plastic containers containing “Dac san dong que CA HU KHO TO Stewed Shark Catfish” with a “BEST BEFORE: Dec 30, 2025.”
- 24.7-ounce plastic containers containing “Dac san dong que CA TRE VANG CHIEN NUOC MAM GUNG Fried Walking Catfish” with a “BEST BEFORE: Dec 30, 2025.”

The products do not bear an establishment number nor a USDA mark of inspection, but bear FDA Registration #10634049806. While the products bear an FDA registration number, FSIS regulates Siluriformes fish and not the FDA. These items were shipped to retail locations in Arizona, California and Iowa. The products were also distributed to nail salons, which either sold the products or used them for promotions.

FSIS discovered the ineligible Siluriformes fish products during routine surveillance activities of imported products at a retail store in California.

There have been no confirmed reports of adverse reactions due to consumption of these products. Anyone concerned about a reaction should contact a health care provider.

FSIS is concerned that consumers may be in possession of these products. Consumers who have purchased or received these products are urged not to consume them. These products should be thrown away or returned to the place of purchase.

FSIS routinely conducts recall effectiveness checks to verify recal…

# Nail Factory Recalls Ineligible Frozen Siluriformes Fish Products Imported From Vietnam

USDA Food Safety and Inspection Service sent this bulletin at 12/19/2024 09:42 PM EST[ Having trouble viewing this email? ](https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USFSIS/bulletins/3c865ed?reqfrom=share)[View it as a Web page](https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USFSIS/bulletins/3c865ed).

[Nail Factory Recalls Ineligible Frozen Siluriformes Fish Products Imported From Vietnam](https://www.fsis.usda.gov/recalls-alerts/nail-factory-recalls-ineligible-frozen-siluriformes-fish-products-imported-vietnam)

NAIL Factory, the importer of record, located in Huntington Beach, Calif., is recalling approximately 1,635 pounds of ineligible frozen Siluriformes fish products that were produced by an establishment in Vietnam that is not eligible to export Siluriformes fish to the United States, the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. Additionally, the products were not presented for import reinspection into the U.S.", "word_count": 142, "snippet_word_count": 142, "snippet_truncated": false, "date_cutoff_start": "2025-01-27T17:41:51.456731", "date_cutoff_end": "2025-02-25T17:41:51.456731", "cached_at": "2025-10-24T03:04:53.903541"}

function.arguments:
{"url": "https://www.provisioneronline.com/articles/118039-nail-factory-recalls-frozen-fish-products", "content": "Nail Factory, the importer of record located in Huntington Beach, Calif., is recalling approximately 1,635 pounds of ineligible frozen Siluriformes fish products that were produced by an establishment in Vietnam that is not eligible to export Siluriformes fish to the United States. Additionally, the products were not presented for import reinspection into the US.

The following products are subject to recall:

- 28.2-ounce plastic containers containing “Dac san dong que CA TRE VANG KHO TO Stewed Walking Catfish” with a “BEST BEFORE: Dec 30, 2025.”
- 28.2-ounce plastic containers containing “Dac san dong que CA HU KHO TO Stewed Shark Catfish” with a “BEST BEFORE: Dec 30, 2025.”
- 24.7-ounce plastic containers containing “Dac san dong que CA TRE VANG CHIEN NUOC MAM GUNG Fried Walking Catfish” with a “BEST BEFORE: Dec 30, 2025.”

The products do not bear an establishment number nor a USDA mark of inspection, but bear FDA Registration #10634049806. While the products bear an FDA registration number, FSIS regulates Siluriformes fish and not the FDA. These items were shipped to retail locations in Arizona, California and Iowa. The products were also distributed to nail salons, which either sold the products or used them for promotions.

FSIS discovered the ineligible Siluriformes fish products during routine surveillance activities of imported products at a retail store in California.

There have been no confirmed reports of adverse reactions due to consumption of these products. Anyone concerned about a reaction should contact a health care provider.

FSIS is concerned that consumers may be in possession of these products. Consumers who have purchased or received these products are urged not to consume them. These products should be thrown away or returned to the place of purchase.

FSIS routinely conducts recall effectiveness checks to verify recall activities have been conducted and that steps are taken to make certain that the product is no longer available to consumers. messages.name: btf_extract_evidence

messages.content:
Based on the gathered evidence, here are the key points regarding the recall of frozen Siluriformes fish products by Nail Factory:

1. **Recall Details**: Nail Factory is recalling approximately 1,635 pounds of frozen Siluriformes fish products imported from Vietnam. These products were produced by an establishment not eligible to export Siluriformes fish to the United States and were not presented for import reinspection.

2. **Distribution**: The recalled products were distributed to retail locations in Arizona, California, and Iowa, as well as to nail salons.

3. **Regulatory Action**: The recall was announced by the USDA's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) on December 19, 2024, due to ineligible fish products and lack of USDA inspection.

4. **Health Impact**: There have been no confirmed reports of adverse reactions due to consumption of these products as of the latest updates.

5. **Current Status**: The recall is still active, and FSIS is conducting routine recall effectiveness checks to ensure the products are no longer available to consumers.

Given that the recall was announced in late December 2024 and considering the typical duration of such recalls, it is plausible that the recall could be closed before April 1, 2025, if the effectiveness checks are completed successfully and no further issues arise.

However, without specific updates indicating the closure of the recall, there remains uncertainty. Based on the information available, I estimate the probability that the recall will be closed before April 1, 2025, as follows:

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.6
